website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy, compact magazine rack that can hold a lot and won't tip over.
pros: Stores well on the floor or on a tabletop
Compact, but large enough to hold 10 magazines and newspapers
cons: May be too small for some large books

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for magazines (with a small mod)
customer_reviews.text: This is much lighter than expected but holds a good number of magazines. Actually, the size will keep me from collecting too many. It will fit in just about any space. The feet are slippery but, in my use, it has not been a problem. There is a tendency for magazines to slip partway out the bottom. Adding two shiny silver colored wires along the bottom stops this from happening.
customer_reviews.author: Pinback

customer_reviews.title: The perfect little magazine holder for the bathroom
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a magazine holder to complement my newly remodeled master bathroom and came across this little jewel. It was well reviewed, nicely priced and came in finish to match my bathroom hardware - all pluses! And it's worked perfectly to hold all my reading material, and look sharp while doing so. I love that the bottom is open so that the inevitable hair and dust bunnies that plagued my older holder can fall right though to be vacuumed away. As you can see from the photo, i have several magazines and catalogs in the holder. It holds a lot of materials. I'm very satisfied. It works as intended.
customer_reviews.author: A. Beason

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing! Perfect for my needs and Cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a couple books in my new bathroom without messing up the simplicity or looking messy (I'm very accustomed to just setting magazines on top of the toilet tank). This was pretty inexpensive (I probably could have checked Ross, Marshalls, etc). And it's so perfect! It's the right size, surprisingly nice quality, and the perfect finish. I chose satin, and it looks like a brushed nickel to me. It's very lightweight, modern... It's sturdy (to a point... I'm sure you could bend it if you really tried). You won't have a problem with magazines slouching down if you use books. I think it's versatile, could go in a large or a small space. Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Hung Ly

customer_reviews.title: Lovely addition to my bathroom and holds about 6 thick magazines.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and looks excellent in my new bathroom. I needed something to put books and magazines, and I didn't want it to take up any surface space. This is not heavy or too sturdy, but it is a great, affordable option for a newspaper/book/magazine rack for the bathroom (or wherever you may need this, but it is definitely meant for bathrooms). It holds about 6 thick fashion magazines. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Yale

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this magazine rack - the magazines actually stand up and don't get all mushed down like with other magazine racks I've used. I purchased one in bronze and one in chrome and they are both well made and look really nice - especially if you have a small bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Carol R.

customer_reviews.title: Nicely sized, compact place to store magazines!
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly sized for a bathroom. My only complaint is that the feet are bare and we have a wood floor, but that is clearly shown in the photo and I purchased it anyway. Seems to be sturdy enough, the wire is holding up nicely and didn't come bent. Small enough to tuck away out of sight and large enough to hold full sized magazines and maybe a folded paper. Good news is that it doesn't hold a ton so it will have to be cleared out sooner rather than later!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Small, but fancy
customer_reviews.text: It's a perfect, light fit for my small NYC bathroom. Feels durable enough, but I don't plan on kicking it around. 4-Stars (just barely) because it does slide around on tile floor, and the magazine can slide down into the lower grooves in the corners from time to time. Just have to stop the roommate from wanting to use it as a second trash can, now. Hah. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Philonious Escobedo

customer_reviews.title: Cute, modern magazine holder
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy and well-made magazine holders, and are very contemporary in design. My only problem with them is the size. Although I read the dimensions a couple of times, they are smaller than I expected. However, they are still useful and attractive and I always have things that need a place to be organized. I purchased two for use in different rooms.
customer_reviews.author: S. Warfield

customer_reviews.title: Attractive Sleek Magazine Storage
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get rid of some of the clutter in my living room—including a large, wicker magazine display unit. I searched Amazon and found this cute little stand from mDesign. I bought two of them because I appreciate symmetry. I already have other black accents in the room, and these magazine stands complement them perfectly. They appear smaller than they really are, because I have at least 20 magazines in each, and there’s still room for more. If you’re looking for attractive, compact magazine storage that fits anywhere, look no more—you have found your product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Shauri

customer_reviews.title: Bought it BECAUSE it is small
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on this and discovered it was exactly what I wanted for a very small space in my bathroom for...well, "bathroom reading material." C'mon, we all do that! Anyway, I have a very small bathroom where every inch of floor space is at a premium, but I had a small area begging for a reading material rack. The finish on this (bronze) matches perfectly with other items in this bathroom, and I've had no problem loading several books and several magazines in it. I consider this a great buy for a small bathroom, would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Regular magazine size small rack for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: Cute little rack will serve a small space in tight quarters. dark brown all metal. Does not have rubber feet, so may need to purchase something if used on surface/floor. Nice price on a lightning deal too. Regular magazines fit nicely 9" x 12" size--even a kindle, if so inclined. Not for large books or newspapers. I like the openness of wires to keep any dampness at bay too.
customer_reviews.author: ArtistMom

customer_reviews.title: Great little magazine rack
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a compact magazine rack to fit in a narrow space in my bathroom for a couple of years. I thought I would take a chance on this mDesign model hoping it wouldn't be a flimsy, cheap piece of junk. It turned out to be exactly what I was seeking. It is well built, modern looking and sized for a small bathroom. Now the magazines in my "library" are neatly and attractively contained awaiting my perusal.
customer_reviews.author: Bud R

customer_reviews.title: Great contemporary looking magazine rack!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect magazine rack for a small space! I've been looking locally for a small magazine holder with no luck and finally decided to look at Amazon....Duh!! Found exactly what I was looking for. This is lightweight, but unless you're apt to kick it around, it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: KIMBERLEE

customer_reviews.title: Wel made and small profile
customer_reviews.text: We replace the powder room toilet recently, and had to ditch the old magazine rack which fitted over the rim of the tank, because the new tank top would not fit with the older one. This stands sturdy by the side of the toilet, is big enough to hold full-size magaziines, as well as a crossword puzzle book. Nicely made, great for small spaces, and stands up well without tipping
customer_reviews.author: G. Simms

customer_reviews.title: Just horrible for magazines
customer_reviews.text: The size & sturdiness were OK, but when I put magazines in it they got all out of shape because parts of them would go out the slots - bottom & sides. I got so disgusted with them that I gave them away and got some cheap plastic ones the same size and they are working beautifully, they don't damage the magazines. I only gave it one star because they are not really for magazines.
customer_reviews.author: Myrta Beem

customer_reviews.title: Great Magazine Rack!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this magazine rack to hold a book or two in the bathroom, next to the toilet. It keeps the books off the ground. It keeps the books in one place and not all over the floor. It is sturdy, but small enough to fit between the toilet and the vanity. I'm so glad I bought this Magazine Rack. Oh, and the color fits right with my decor.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Masson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and color
customer_reviews.text: We needed a small magazine rack for between 2 recliners in a small space. This fit perfectly, and holds all the items we wanted it to. It came in the bronze that matches the standing lamp, etc., so we were thrilled. Very much enjoying the missing clutter! It is nice and sturdy so I expect to be enjoying it for many, many years. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Kinsman

customer_reviews.title: Solved A Silly Problem
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the bathroom!! Holds more than I expected it to and seems very sturdily made. My boyfriend kept putting his magazines on the edge of the tub and of course a lot of them ended up in the tub. What a doof!
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Gal

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fit
customer_reviews.text: The. Magazines tend to slip through the openings and curl up. Don’t care for how the magazines don’t stand up and are difficult to keep easily accessible. Wouldn’t but this again.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen mckillip

customer_reviews.title: Works in a tight space.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to slide between my bed and bedside table. Perfect for that. Holds whatever book and magazine I’m reading at the time. I was afraid the corners of the books/magazines would catch on the edges of the horizontal rings, and they do, so that’s my only complaint t about the design. Otherwise, it works for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Forever49

customer_reviews.title: Great scale
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scale in 2012. About a week ago it failed. I changed the batteries thinking that was the issue but sadly it wasn't. I wrote to the company and they sent suggestions which did not work. I ended up purchasing a new one. this was made in China it is 6 years old sadly things made in China don't last. Now I loved this scale best one I ever had for accuracy and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Trust

customer_reviews.title: Great Leaders have Great Coaches
customer_reviews.text: As businesses respond to a grandscale reordering of their respective industries, I can find no better guide for coaching C-Suite Executives and Middle Leadership on navigating the currents of change. Defining reality and seeking the unvarnished truth is not only a crucible experience, it is career defining which makes this book a must read for those who understand that today the stakes are higher and no leader can go it alone. Seeing oneself clearly and valuing coaching moments will make the difference between success and failure. I applaud the authors for this practical, actionable and thoughtful guide for finding opportunity during a time of crisis and a standard for coaching in general.
customer_reviews.author: Denise L Ladner

customer_reviews.title: Simple, works fine
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special, gets the job done. A little pricey for what it is, but was the cheapest one I could find. Wish it were a little higher off the ground as I'm afraid a wayward splash or wet towel is going to ruin the magazines (I keep it next to the tub for reading material for the bath, so my fault here).
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Science

customer_reviews.title: Great magazine rack!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a lovely addition to my living room!! Now my magazines aren't sprawled all over the place. I had the perfect will nook for this thing too- right between one of my side tables and chairs. I haven't had any issues with magazines slipping out the bottom or it tipping over as others have stated. I've packed this thing with at least 10-12 magazines and could probably squeeze in a couple more!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmin Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Received quickly. Product is exactly as described and fits perfectly in my bathroom. I would definitely recommend it for anyone who has lots of reading material that needs control!
customer_reviews.author: J. Cottone

customer_reviews.title: Great modern looking magazine rack
customer_reviews.text: A lot nicer than I though it would be. A got the Graphite and it looks very modern and sleek. When I took it out of the package I was thinking it is way to light to not fall over easily, but it's surprisingly sturdy and steady with even tall magazines. It has a very small footprint, so it doesn't take up much space. A solid magazine rack!
customer_reviews.author: Kat J

customer_reviews.title: Nice....
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey for what it is exactly, but fits my bathroom perfectly & does the trick to hold magazines & books. Wish the wire was tighter to each other so magazines don’t partially slide through. But no real issues. Good purchase...
customer_reviews.author: JoeSarks

customer_reviews.title: Totally my fault, but this is dollhouse size--should be indicated in title
customer_reviews.text: Not blaming them, but perhaps they could say "small magazine rack" in the description; it simply because magazine racks usually don't come in this mini size. I didn't check (again, my fault) because I didn't think I would be getting a tiny, usable magazine rack. Back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Tron Honto

customer_reviews.title: Magazine holder
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect and exactly what I was looking for. They fit perfectly in my small bathroom and doesn't take up a lot of room. I would definitely recommend this product, it's very well made. I ordered two of them.
customer_reviews.author: Dora B.

customer_reviews.title: Such an cute, easy fix for clutter.
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this magazine rack! It's sturdy, narrow and fits perfectly by my bed; it even holds my laptop. I am ordering another for my husband's sidenof the bed. (I might even get one for my family room).
customer_reviews.author: Tracie R.

customer_reviews.title: Fits magazines perfectly.....
customer_reviews.text: Nice modern magazine holder that goes well with the toilet paper holder of same brand. Fits many magazines and is a perfect size for bathroom. Nice weight and looks nice. Chrome goes well with bath fixtures.
customer_reviews.author: Bretsmom

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t be happier!  Compact, but plenty of room.
customer_reviews.text: Needed something small to hold books and magazines in our kid’s bathroom. Couldn’t be happier. Large, odd-shaped picture books fit well next to comic books, nothing is lost. Looks great! Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: shawn m espinosa

customer_reviews.title: Petite and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This small magazine holder works very well next to my upstairs reading chair. It is a pretty bronze color, built well, and will hold a book and a few magazines. Make sure you understand the dimensions, so that you don't expect something bigger. I am pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AAFF

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my bathroom
customer_reviews.text: We have a small half bath that left zero room for a trashcan. We decided to use a magazine rack as a trashcan and it works perfectly. Black magazine rack on the left, white magazine right/trashcan on the right.
customer_reviews.author: DnSMills

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly sized magazine rack
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a magazine rack but nothing that took up too much space. This particular rack was just the right size for me. Some people may want something that holds more, but I think it’s got more than enough room for what most people would be looking for. Plus, it looks great!
customer_reviews.author: C. Prejean

customer_reviews.title: Perfect...
customer_reviews.text: Just the size I wanted. Fits great at the end of my coffee table. It holds more than you would think. The copper is a great color. Seems very sturdy...And the best thing is now these books/magazines are off of the floor under the coffee table.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybug

customer_reviews.title: Great umbrella holder!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something for a small space under a table by my door to hold umbrellas. I don't know why all umbrella holders are so big when most of us use compact umbrellas these days. Ten umbrellas fit in this nicely. (I don't know why I have ten umbrellas, but this holds them all.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice for a cheap magazine rack
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use in our "water closet" (toilet in master bath), so there's limited space for magazines. This rack seems to be working our nicely. All the magazines fit standing up but it doesn't appear unstable. The brushed stainless fits the location nicely. So far, we like it.
customer_reviews.author: Wes from Carrollton,  VA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small magazine rack
customer_reviews.text: I was sick and looking at the newspaper laying on the floor of our bathroom and I came across this rack. It is perfect for magazines and folded newspaper. I no longer looking at half folded messy newspaper on my bathroom floor. It’s sturdy and perfect for small areas.
customer_reviews.author: Slacker

customer_reviews.title: Not Practical.
customer_reviews.text: It's attractive and I chose it for my bathroom, but it's very small and lost looking on the floor even though it has legs......which are very short. I would hang it on a small wall, but it would stick out quite a bit. Not really happy with it. The pic shows it holding a large book, but I think it would fall over with a book that size. It's very lightweight. In hind sight...........
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a bathroom
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small magazine rack to go in the guest bathroom. This is perfect. It is small enough to fit tidily next to the toilet, but big enough to hold multiple magazines. The wire design is great to keep dust from settling in the bottom. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lee in TN

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I just opened my Amazon package yesterday and got this. The item looks cheaply built and easily bent out of shape. Looks nice though but not sure how long will this last. I believe the retail price point of this should be around $10 or less.
customer_reviews.author: Brydge_VSP

customer_reviews.title: Ends clutter!
customer_reviews.text: Tired of the clutter, I decided to give this magazine holder a try and it certainly fits the bill. Small and compact, it holds a good number of magazines and ends the clutter on my table. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kukla

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Simple but functional.
customer_reviews.text: Looks just like the picture. Meets my needs as planned. Simple but functional. Magazines don't fall over like in other larger racks. Compact size works well in small bathrooms or separate lavatory rooms.
customer_reviews.author: BobV

customer_reviews.title: Small size but can hold a few magazines or books
customer_reviews.text: This was just the right size for smaller bathroom. Comments from friends small but right size for room. Also metal color in silver add a brightness to the room. Very happy with product
customer_reviews.author: ptrams

customer_reviews.title: The black brushed finish makes the rack NOT stick out like a sore thumb
customer_reviews.text: These always arrive early for us. This may be a different experience than most people. The quality is slightly higher than what your paying for. The black brushed finish makes the rack NOT stick out like a sore thumb. Recommended. Keep in mind that the bars are horizontal, the edges of the magazines may catch, leaving with frayed edges. Either than that it's working for us well.
customer_reviews.author: French Cut

customer_reviews.title: The felines can't chew on it!
customer_reviews.text: This item replaced a wicker basket which held magazines in our first floor bath. Well our two cats just couldn't resist chewing on the basket, and you know the rest. :) They don't chew on this!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Groton, CT

customer_reviews.title: Great little magazine rack
customer_reviews.text: Love this little magazine rack. I have it beside my recliner and it holds a magazine or two plus my Bible and my Kindle. It fits snugly against my recliner and looks great!
customer_reviews.author: IH

customer_reviews.title: Great size, does t use a lot of space, looks good, love feet.
customer_reviews.text: Like that they have feet. Hold magazine upright. Looks small but when I put the magazine in it fits perfect for my magazines small and large. Holds guide a few. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Bouvy

customer_reviews.title: It is just what it claimed to be in every way.
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what I was looking for. Needed something small and sturdy for my reading materials next to my bedroom recliner. Really perfect. Probably will order another for my bathroom. Liked that there are choices in colors.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Great magazine rack
customer_reviews.text: Nice magazine rack. Bought for my bathroom. It looks great with the stainless steel toilet bowl brush set too. This magazine rack is very sturdy and holds a lot of magazines/books/newspapers. Will probably buy another one for another bathroom I have.
customer_reviews.author: Walden

customer_reviews.title: stylishly cool
customer_reviews.text: This magazine rack will hold up to 17 magazines securely. It is not bulky at all. It isn't overly large like the old school magazine racks. It's a perfect size and looks good anywhere. I use one in my bedroom for magazines and other sits on the kitchen counter where it holds all the daily random papers and items that I want corralled. Mine are matte black.
customer_reviews.author: bw

customer_reviews.title: This was exactly as described and fits well in small ...
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly as described and fits well in small spaces. It has cleaned up the counter of the magazines and made them more accessible.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Useful!
customer_reviews.text: Sleek and compact, but still holds a good amount of mags/books. Mags may slip out near the bottom if not placed well, but otherwise well-designed and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: quality searcher

customer_reviews.title: great rack
customer_reviews.text: Nothing I didn't like about it. Was small enough for the space I wanted it to fit into, but large enough to hold the books or magazines I put in there. Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Long Sam

customer_reviews.title: It works so I kept it, but it is ...
customer_reviews.text: It works so I kept it, but it is very small...smaller than the picture makes it look and it is very light so it feels cheap. If I had seen it in a store, I would not have purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Weanling

customer_reviews.title: SMALL
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy enough and all but A LOT smaller than I thought it would be. But that’s what you get when you have to shop online... Something like this would be under 10 bucks at Marshall’s or TJ Maxx. Little annoyed it was $14.99. Thanks Covid 19!
customer_reviews.author: The Great Cornholio

customer_reviews.title: Love it, But a little too small.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the magazine holder; however, it is very small, much smaller than I expected. It is very pretty, shiny and would be ideal, if only it was a little larger. I still really like it thought and I'm disappointed, but very happy.
customer_reviews.author: LeLee

customer_reviews.title: Some reading while you wait...
customer_reviews.text: A bit smaller than expected...but I usually don't read the fine print. It is what it is, and does what it does, and fits the decor of the bathroom. I filled it w/several mags to entertain those gettin' busy. Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Louis Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Great product for my magazines.
customer_reviews.text: Needed something that was sturdy and roomy for my magazines in my small bathrooms. This was the perfect solution. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: H. Ball

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something attractive to fit all of those magazines and catalogs that clutter up my table and this was perfect. Wide enough to be sturdy. Looks good, fits a good amount. I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly as described. Although it is meant more for magazines and thin reading materials I placed it beside my chair and put a few books in it and it looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: purchased again
customer_reviews.text: liked it so much bought another one - perfect for bathroom to keep books and magazines. i use for all my toddlers' books.
customer_reviews.author: KMS0808

customer_reviews.title: Attractive metal basket.
customer_reviews.text: Love this metal basket. Sturdy and compact size. I’ve purchased 2 now and use them to hold magazines and paper.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This magazine rack works great for small bathrooms. It has a very nice low profile, however it holds many magazines.
customer_reviews.author: desertwinds

customer_reviews.title: Classic Elegance in a Magazine Holder
customer_reviews.text: I like the design and make of this magazine holder. It’s classically elegant, well built, functional, and makes my coffee table really shine.
customer_reviews.author: S Man

customer_reviews.title: Cute on the counter
customer_reviews.text: For a bathroom looks pretty on the counter. Wish it had silicone covered feet to protect it from rust.
customer_reviews.author: puddintane

customer_reviews.title: wish I would've gotten it sooner!
customer_reviews.text: It looks super classy and I love it! Great amount of space for all my magazines and newspapers
customer_reviews.author: Rivka123

customer_reviews.title: Clean and Simple
customer_reviews.text: I did not want something big (not a big magazine collector) but I did want something with a simple with a clean look. This was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Songbird

customer_reviews.title: Super good looking!
customer_reviews.text: What a great value! This is a lovely, well made, modern magazine rack. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: gingerky

customer_reviews.title: Great magazine/ file holder!
customer_reviews.text: I love this magazine holder! It's solid, stable and holds a variety of magazines in a compact way, It will fit on a low shelf, under a desk or on the floor. After the first one, I ordered a second one to hold misc. desk files. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The second one arrived in perfect condition and I love it
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived completely bent and would not even sit evenly on the floor. I returned it to Amazon for a refund, then purchased the same one. The second one arrived in perfect condition and I love it. The wires are close together, so books don't slip through it like they did with my old one.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: The magazine basket is nice, but smaller than I expected. I can only hold about six magazines. It does work fine in the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Small space solution
customer_reviews.text: I have a very small bathroom. This fits the space so much better than a bulky basket and corrals reading material that used to be scattered on the floor
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn J

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Seemed somewhat smaller than expected but fits where planned to place. It helps discourage keeping excess magazines and gives a elegant look to space it occupies.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great magazine rack for the bathroom because it holds quite a bit, yet takes up very little room. Wish it were just a little bit bigger. It is of excellent quality & very attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon/LasVegas,NV

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Doesn’t tip over
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. Doesn’t tip over even when top heavy books are placed inside. Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Naylee
customer_reviews.text: I really like it and nothing to put together! Its look great in my living room. I am going to order another one for my bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small space.Magazine or newspaper rack.
customer_reviews.text: Small size still holds newspapers or magazine. Since it stores items in an upright position, it takes up little space.
customer_reviews.author: Macy

customer_reviews.title: I love being able to have my magazines right next to ...
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to have my magazines right next to me when I'm relaxing. However I do wish it had a stand with feet or coasters so it was off the direct floor. I still love it because now my end tables are not littered with all my magazines.
customer_reviews.author: M Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Nice magazine holder
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this magazine rack. It's pretty, solid, and seems durable. My magazines fit nicely and it doesn't take up too much room.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Great for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it was not as bulky as some others, and it fits nicely where we use it. Our living room is not very big, and this works very well.
customer_reviews.author: L. Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and just the right size for my personal use
customer_reviews.text: A perfect size for my magazines, books, clipboard Handy yer out of the way, right next to my chair.
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size for a Small Bathroom
customer_reviews.text: If you need it to place a lot of magazines, this would not be a good choice. I needed it for my bathroom and I have a small bathroom so it fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sayonara

customer_reviews.title: Modern Magazine Rack
customer_reviews.text: Simple clean modern lines at a very good price. I bought two of these for our bathrooms. They fit well between the wall and the toilet. Magazines fit easily into them. The quality is excellent. I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Basil

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and color. Was exactly what I needed for my rather small bathroom. Only gave 4 stars for durability because I haven't had it very long. It seems to be sturdy enough for holding magazines. Happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: Not too large but easily holds magazines. I would like to see one with a small side basket attached to hold writing instruments and glasses.

customer_reviews.title: Simple yet very modern looking.  Very happy with my purchases.
customer_reviews.text: I like the look, simple yet modern. I bought 4 of these to update heavy wooden magazine racks that were definitely dated. Very happy with my purchases.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Rubber pads would help to keep it in place on wood or tile floors.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for us!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a magazine holder for a small bathroom. This is working out great for us. It is narrow enough to fit between bathtub and toilet and can hold a few magazines and/or a book!
customer_reviews.author: tlh

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with contemporary look
customer_reviews.text: I have s very small bathroom and this magazine holder fits perfectly in between sink cabinet and commode. Brushed nickel matches bathroom hardware. Very pleased with contemporary look.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and perfect size!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for small spaces! Will hold several magazines, news papers or books.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small bathroom!
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my bathroom, size is just right, it’s simple but works and I like that I had several color/finish options to choose from.

customer_reviews.title: Great to hold Cutting Boards in Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an alternative to hold all my cutting boards. Works GREAT!!! Very sturdy and with the open bottom, I can even put them in there wet and just put a dish towel underneath until they are dry

product_meta.title: mDesign Decorative Metal Farmhouse Magazine Holder and Organizer Bin - Standing Rack for Magazines, Books, Newspapers, Tablets in Bathroom, Family Room, Office, Den - Matte Black
product_meta.description: Color:Matte BlackKeep bathroom spaces clean and clutter free with the Freestanding Magazine Holder and Organizer from mDesign. The wire basket holds all your reading materials in one convenient location. The open wire construction makes it simple to see what's stashed inside, while the petite design easily fits into small or crowded bathroom spaces. Raised feet on the bottom of the basket keep magazines and newspapers off of bathroom floors so they always stay clean and dry.
feature_bullets: SMART STORAGE: Freestanding magazine holder stores and organizes reading materials in one convenient place; Raised feet ensure that reading materials stay off bathroom floors so they are always clean and dry; The oval shape fits in small or crowded bathroom spaces

STYLISH DESIGN: The clean lines and metal wire design of this magazine basket make it a style statement in any home, apartment, condo, or dorm; Gridded wire design makes seeing what is stashed inside simple

FUNCTIONAL & VERSATILE: Use this modern magazine holder in any room of your home; Place it by a chair or end table and store your favorite books, newspapers or magazines, or by the entryway for mail, catalogs and paperwork; Also use in living rooms, family rooms, bedrooms, offices, and more
QUALITY CONSTRUCTION: Made of strong steel wire with a durable rust-resistant finish; Easy Care - Wipe clean with damp cloth
THOUGHTFULLY SIZED: Measures 6" x 12" x 8.5" high
